```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(caret)
library(AppliedPredictiveModeling)
library(glmnet)
library(mgcv)
library(MASS)
library(pROC)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  fig.width = 6, 
  fig.asp = .6,
  out.width = "90%")

theme_set(theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "bottom"))

options(
  ggplot2.continuous.colour = "viridis",
  ggplot2.continuous.fill = "viridis"
)

scale_colour_discrete = scale_colour_viridis_d
scale_fill_discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d
```

# Prepare the data

```{r}
# Prepare the data
data = read_csv("winequality-red.csv") %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  mutate(
    quality = case_when(
      quality < 7 ~ "poor", 
      quality >= 7 ~ "good"
    ), 
    quality = as.factor(quality), 
    quality = fct_relevel(quality, c("poor", "good"))
  ) 

# partition
set.seed(105)
indexTrain <- createDataPartition(y = data$quality, p = 0.7, list = FALSE)
train <- data[indexTrain, ] 
test <- data[-indexTrain, ]

train_x = data.matrix(train %>% dplyr::select(-quality))
train_y = train$quality

test_x = data.matrix(test %>% dplyr::select(-quality))
test_y = test$quality
```

# Exploratory analysis

```{r}
# numerical summary
summary(data)

# graphical summary
theme1 <- transparentTheme(trans = .4)
trellis.par.set(theme1)

featurePlot(x = data[ , c(1:11)], 
            y = data$quality,
            scales = list(x = list(relation = "free"), 
                          y = list(relation = "free")),
            plot = "density", pch = "|", 
            auto.key = list(columns = 2)
            )
```

The dataset has 1599 observations and 12 variables. The outcome variable is `quality`, and the predictors are `fixed_acidity`, `volatile_acidity`, `citric_acid`, `residual_sugar`, `chlorides`, `free_sulfur_dioxide`, `total_sulfur_dioxide`, `density`, `p_h`, `sulphates`, `alcohol`. Among these variables, only `quality` is categorical, and the others are continuous. \

According to the density plots, we can see that a better quality score might be associated with higher amount of sulphates, higher percent alcohol content, lower amount of chlorides, lower volatile acidity, higher amount of citric acid. 

# Models
## Logistic

```{r glm}
# Logistic regression
set.seed(105)
glm.fit = glm(quality ~ ., 
              data = data, 
              subset = indexTrain, 
              family = binomial(link = "logit"))
summary(glm.fit)

# using caret
ctrl1 <- trainControl(method = "repeatedcv", repeats = 5,
                     summaryFunction = twoClassSummary,
                     classProbs = TRUE)

model.glm = train(train_x,
                  train_y,
                  method = "glm",
                  metric = "ROC",
                  trControl = ctrl1)
summary(model.glm)
```

Here, we fit a logistic regression using the training data, and at a significant level of 0.05, `volatile_acidity`, `residual_sugar`, `chlorides`, `total_sulfur_dioxide`, `sulphates`, `alcohol` appear to be statistically significant. 

## GAM

```{r gam}
set.seed(105)
model.gam <- train(train_x,
                   train_y,
                   method = "gam",
                   metric = "ROC",
                   trControl = ctrl1)
model.gam$finalModel

```

## MARS

```{r mars}
set.seed(105)
mars_grid <- expand.grid(degree = 1:3, nprune = 2:25)

mars.fit <- train(train_x, train_y,
                  method = "earth",
                  tuneGrid = mars_grid,
                  trControl = ctrl1)
summary(mars.fit)
ggplot(mars.fit)
mars.fit$bestTune
```

## Penalized logistic

```{r}
glmnGrid <- expand.grid(.alpha = seq(0, 1, length = 6),
                        .lambda = exp(seq(-8, -1, length = 20)))
set.seed(105)
model.glmn <- train(train_x, 
                    train_y,
                    method = "glmnet",
                    tuneGrid = glmnGrid,
                    metric = "ROC",
                    trControl = ctrl1)
model.glmn$bestTune
summary(model.glmn)
#glmn.pred <- predict(model.glmn, newdata = testData_median, type = "prob")[,2]
#roc.glmn <- roc(testData_median$target, glmn.pred)
```

## LDA

```{r}
set.seed(105)
lda.fit <- lda(quality ~ ., 
               data = data,
               subset = indexTrain)
plot(lda.fit)
summary(lda.fit)

#using caret 
set.seed(105)
model.lda <- train(train_x,
                   train_y,
                   method = "lda",
                   metric = "ROC",
                   trControl = ctrl1)
```



## Confusion Matrix for test data
```{r}
# confusion matrix 
test.pred.prob <- predict(glm.fit, newdata = test,
                           type = "response")
test.pred <- rep("poor", length(test.pred.prob))
test.pred[test.pred.prob > 0.5] <- "good"

confusionMatrix(data = as.factor(test.pred),
                reference = test_y,
                positive = "good")
```


# Model Selection

```{r}
res <- resamples(list(glm = model.glm,
                      glmn = model.glmn,
                      gam = model.gam,
                      mars = mars.fit,
                      lda = model.lda))
summary(res)
bwplot(res, metric = "ROC")
```

# ROC curve

```{r}
# ROC curve for MARS
glmn.pred <- predict(model.glmn, newdata = test_x, type = "prob")[,2]
roc.glmn <- roc(test_y, glmn.pred)
plot(roc.glmn, legacy.axes = TRUE)

# AUC
auc_glmn <- roc.glmn$auc[1]
auc_glmn
```
